scenario:
Illinois Tool Works Inc. (ITW) reported its fourth quarter and full year 2024 results, with revenue of $3.9 billion and $15.9 billion, respectively, a decrease of 1.3% and 1.3% from the same periods in 2023. Organic growth declined 0.5% and 0.7% in the fourth quarter and full year, respectively. 

The company achieved a record operating margin of 26.2% in the fourth quarter and 26.8% in the full year, with enterprise initiatives contributing 120 basis points and 130 basis points, respectively. Operating cash flow was $1.1 billion and $3.3 billion, and free cash flow was $1 billion and $2.8 billion, with a conversion of 133% and 94% to net income, respectively.

For 2025, ITW projects above-market organic growth of 0 to 2% and organic revenue growth of 1 to 3% excluding Product Line Simplification (PLS) reduction of approximately 1%. The company expects enterprise initiatives to contribute approximately 100 basis points to margin improvement. GAAP EPS is projected to be in the range of $10.15 to $10.55 per share, including a foreign currency translation headwind of $0.30.

ITW's seven industry-leading segments leverage the unique ITW Business Model to drive solid growth with best-in-class margins and returns in markets where highly innovative, customer-focused solutions are required. The company's approximately 44,000 dedicated colleagues around the world thrive in the company's decentralized and entrepreneurial culture.
